definition:
We have fixed $\alpha$ as the maximum acceptable probability of
commiting a type $I$ error. But associated with each normalized test of
significance is $\gamma$, the probability of commiting a type $I$ error.

Notice that as we make $\gamma$ smaller, the smaller the critical region
becomes and thus the larger the value of the test statistic must be for
the null hypothesis to be rejected.

Find $p$, defined as the smallest $\gamma$ for which we can still reject
$H_0$.

Reject $H_0$ if $\alpha < p$.
